agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with a Catholic perspective offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services throughout central and southern Indiana.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: For emergency care, walk in. -- For billing and financial assistance, call the Financial Services office. -- For physician referrals, call the CARE Line. -- For all other services, including patient information, call the Switchboard.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services to those who have been victims of crime.
site_name: HOOSIER HILLS PACT - DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SHELTER & TRANSITIONAL HOUSING
service_description: Provides transitional housing up to 24 months for those who have left an abusive relationship and need to become self sufficient. Residents are provided case management services and assistance locating employment and childcare.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to fill out an application and to be placed on wait list.
site_eligibility:
○Victims of homelessness due to domestic violence and/or sexual assault 
○Must have steady employment
Victims of domestic violence and/or sexual assault with or without children

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing comprehensive behavioral health, addiction, and related services.
service_description: Provides comprehensive services to adults with mental health issues. Assessments may be done to determine treatment options including individual counseling, group therapy, case management, or psychiatric services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Psychiatric Disorder Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-7pm

site_schedule.name: Mental Health Evaluation
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-7pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-7pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-7pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-7pm

site_schedule.name: Mental Health Evaluation
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-7pm

site_schedule.name: Child and Adolescent Psychiatry
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-7pm

site_eligibility: Living in Washington County -- Ages 18 or older
Open
Living in Washington County -- Youth ages 5-17

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a range of primary medical services (including general, school/sports/employment exams; disease management; laboratory testing; and urgent care for minor illnesses) to patients of all ages.
site_details: Walk in for urgent care or call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including limited financial assistance, free meal, and clothing pantry.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for utilities and limited rent assistance to people in need. Must first seek assistance from the Township Trustee. Does not provide money or gift cards for gasoline.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. Walk-ins also accepted

site_schedule.name: Rent Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Tues 9am-1pm; Wed noon-1:30pm; Fri 9am-12:30pm; by appointment only

site_schedule.name: Electric Service Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Tues 9am-1pm; Wed noon-1:30pm; Fri 9am-12:30pm; by appointment only

site_schedule.name: Gas Service Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Tues 9am-1pm; Wed noon-1:30pm; Fri 9am-12:30pm; by appointment only

site_schedule.name: Water Service Payment Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Tues 9am-1pm; Wed noon-1:30pm; Fri 9am-12:30pm; by appointment only

site_eligibility: Living in Washington County -- Must first seek assistance from the Township Trustee -- Have not had assistance in the last year
Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry serving Washington County.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in Washington County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 6 months and older
Open -- Individuals must have a prescription that requires needles/sharps
Open

Open -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Varies by service; serves Washington County
Varies by service; call for details.
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County
Varies by service; Open
Age 19 or older -- Living in Wabash County

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 15), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Crawford, Lawrence, Orange, and Washington County. Also serves as the areas Economic Development Corporation for Crawford, Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Lawrence, Martin, Orange, Pike and Washington County.
site_name: SALEM SENIOR CITIZENS CENTER - WASHINGTON COUNTY MEAL SITE
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship every weekday for area seniors. Diabetic menu available. Reservations required at least 24 hours in advance. Small donation requested.
site_details: Call Hoosier Uplands at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Persons age 60 or older

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Washington County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Washington County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Washington County
Open

agency_desc: A government-operated, 24-hour emergency dispatch service.
service_description: Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and ambulances in Washington County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the 24-hour, nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in the county.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Washington County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers sandbags to Washington County households during times of flooding.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open
People living in a mobile home

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Washington County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Petition Filing Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Washington County
Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult in Washington County.

To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Washington County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) --- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents of Washington Township in Washington County. Circulates books, audio books, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Washington Township
To participate: Age 18 or older -- To volunteer: Age 18 or older -- Must be able to pass background check

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides transportation to VA medical appointments for area veterans to the veterans' hospital in Louisville, Kentucky. Vehicle is not wheelchair accessible.   Also assistance in filing VA compensation and/or pension claims.  If home-bound, County Veterans Service Officer is available to visit and assist filing claims  by appointment on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday 8am to 4pm.weekly for home-bound veterans and/or widows of veterans
site_details: For ride to VA appointments, call at least 72 hours in advance to schedule transportation.
site_eligibility: With an appointment at the veterans' hospital in Louisville, Kentucky
Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Salem in Washington County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Salem in Washington County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Salem in Washington County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Salem in Washington County.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Salem, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, microchipping of pets, humane euthanasia for terminally ill pets, adoption for homeless dogs and cats, and volunteer opportunities.
site_details: Call for information.

site_schedule.schedule: Tues-Fri 1pm-5pm; Sat 12:30pm-3:30pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Salem in Washington County.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Salem in Washington County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Salem in Washington County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Salem in Washington County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Salem

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Salem in Washington County.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for the city of Salem in Washington County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; services limited to properties within Salem city limits

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Salem in Washington County.
service_description: Provides water and sanitary sewer utility services for the city of Salem in Washington County.

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: The Washington County Surveyor's Office maintains land mapping and boundaries congruent with the best interests of the county and its citizens through section cornerstones, maintaining the county regulated drain system, and field surveying as necessary.
service_description: Provides the following county services; maintains section corners; files legal surveys; maintains voter precinct maps, annexation, and de-annexation; investigates drainage obstructions; and researches and documents all cemeteries in Washington County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Bodies
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to properties in Washington County)

agency_desc: Records, files, and preserves all documentation in the realm of property records.
service_description: Maintains a permanent record of real estate deeds, mortgages, mortgage releases, affidavits, and other submitted documents. Makes recorded documents a matter of public record and provides certified copies on request.
site_details: Call or walk in for service.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to properties in Washington County)

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or walk in for information.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Washington County
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election
Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Receives payment of property taxes.
service_description: Collects taxes and in the case of delinquent taxes may order the sale of real property to pay delinquent taxes. Receives distributions of local income and other taxes that are collected by the state such as real estate tax, personal property tax, mobile home tax, state assessed tax, and the following miscellaneous taxes: auto excise tax, inheritance tax, and innkeeper's tax.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to properties in Washington County)

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Washington County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Washington County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: 1st and 3rd Tues 9am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: 1st and 3rd Tues 9am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Salem in Washington County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Salem in Washington County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Salem in Washington County

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Salem in Washington County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in Washington Township and the city of Salem in Washington County. Non-emergency services include fire prevention education and public awareness. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in Washington Township and the city of Salem in Washington County

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization that provides pregnancy counseling and services, parenting classes and material assistance.
service_description: Provides a faith-based educational curriculum for pregnant women and parents. Participants receive material assistance based upon attendance at education classes. Participants earn "Boutique Bucks" that are redeemed at Blessings Boutique. Offers a Step Up Fatherhood service for men only that provides mentoring and classes focusing on character building and parenting. Men also earn "Daddy Dollars" that are redeemed at Blessings Boutique.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, couples, fathers and parents with young children -- Man Up: Men only
Pregnant women or couples and parents with young children
Must be willing to participate in parenting and life skills program (Step Up Parenting Resources).
